title: Virginia Governor Race 2021: What to Watch for on Election Day
sub_head: Terry McAuliffe and Glenn Youngkin face off in tight race as other elections take place around the U.S.
body:
Virginia voters head to the polls Tuesday to choose their next governor in a competitive race between Democratic former Gov. Terry McAuliffe and Republican businessman Glenn Youngkin. Nearly every recent poll has shown an even contest, a potential sign of change, because Republicans haven’t won a statewide race in Virginia since 2009.
Also Tuesday, voters in New Jersey will decide their governor, and dozens of cities will vote in mayoral races. Voters in Boston are poised to elect a woman as mayor for the first time in the city’s history. The Minneapolis election—the first since the unrest following the killing of George Floyd in May 2020—includes a mayoral race and a ballot item to decide whether to replace the police department with a department of public safety.
